info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:55PM MDT until June 21 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL EL PASO COUNTY... At 355 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Falcon, or 13 miles northeast of Colorado Springs, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Colorado Springs, Black Forest, Peyton, Falcon and Cimarron Hills. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
